I leaned back in my creaky chair, taking a long drag from my Lucky Strike.  "Depends on what kinda 'best' we're talkin' about, doll. Spill it."

"Missing persons ain't exactly my forte, sweetheart," I drawled, eyeing her up and down. Something wasn't adding up.

She placed a photograph on my desk - a handsome brute with slicked-back hair and a cocky smirk. "Victor DeVille. Wealthy businessman. Powerful friends. And enemies too, I reckon."
